refnamediv.refpurpose: tool to take pictures and videos from your webcam

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: cheese uses your webcam to take photos and videos, applies fancy special effects and lets you share the fun with others. It was written as part of Google's 2007 Summer of Code lead by daniel g. siegel and mentored by RaphaÃ«l Slinckx. Under the hood, Cheese uses GStreamer to apply fancy effects to photos and videos. With Cheese it is easy to take photos of you, your friends, pets or whatever you want and share them with others. After the success of the Summer of Code, the development continued and we are still looking for people with nice ideas and patches ;)

refsect1.title: Invocation
refsect1.para: cheese takes a list of options as arguments.

listitem.para: Start in wide mode, with the thumbnails to the right of the video preview.
Use the supplied DEVICE as the video capture device.
Start in borderless mode (no window decorations). In borderless mode, left mouse button moves the window and right mouse button resizes from corners while preserving the camera's aspect ratio.
Start with action bar (buttons) toggled off.
Start with thumbnails view toggled off.
Keep the main window above other windows.
Specify the window width in pixels.
Specify the window height in pixels.
Make the window position follow the cursor on the screen. Useful for mini-UI mode where the window can be resized very small.
Adjust the responsiveness of cursor following by refresh interval in milliseconds. Implies --follow. Default is 1000ms.
X-offset of window top-left to cursor. Default is 10 pixels.
Y-offset of window top-left to cursor. Default is 10 pixels.
Enable auto-shoot mode. Automatically takes photos repeatedly at specified intervals.
Specify directory to save captured photos. Automatically creates the directory with parent directories if they don't exist.
Specify shoot interval in milliseconds for auto-shoot mode. Default is 1000ms.
